1.explanation: If the ball costs $0.05, the bat costs $1.05 ($1.00 more), totaling $1.10.

2.explanation: Each machine makes one widget in 5 minutes. 100 machines each making one widget still takes 5 minutes.

3.explanation: Since the patch doubles daily, the day before full coverage (day 48) it was half covered: day 47.

4.explanation: You passed the person in 2nd place, so you take their position—2nd place. You didn’t pass the person in 1st.

5.explanation: The question says “Emily’s father has three daughters.” Emily is the third daughter—her name is in the question itself.

6.explanation: “All but 8 died” means 8 survived. The answer is 8, not 15 minus 8.

7.explanation: John drinks 1/6 per day, Mary drinks 1/12 per day. Together: 1/6 + 1/12 = 1/4 barrel per day, so 4 days total.

resultTexts.followedCorrectAI: You followed correct AI—like 92.7% of participants in the study.
resultTexts.followedFaultyAI: Cognitive surrender. You followed faulty AI—like 79.8% of participants.
resultTexts.overrodeFaultyAI: Cognitive offloading. You overrode faulty AI—only 20.2% managed this.
resultTexts.overrodeCorrectAI: You overrode correct AI—only 7.3% of participants did this.
resultTexts.noAIBrainOnly: You relied on your own reasoning—no AI was available in your condition.
resultTexts.noAIIndependent: You relied on your own reasoning (Independent).

brainOnly.name: Brain-Only
brainOnly.text: You were assigned to the Brain-Only condition—just like 121 participants in Study 1 who had no access to AI. They averaged 45.8% accuracy. You got {totalCorrect}/7 ({pct}%). Brain-Only participants serve as the control group—their performance reflects pure human reasoning without any AI influence.

independent.name: Independent
independent.prefixNeverUsed: You had access to AI but never consulted it—you relied entirely on your own cognition.
independent.prefixUsedOnce: You consulted the AI just once out of 7 questions.
independent.text: In the study, Independents (≤1 AI use, n = 170 in Study 2) primarily relied on their own reasoning. Under normal conditions, Independents averaged 51.5% accuracy—similar to Brain-Only participants (45.8%). You got {totalCorrect}/7 ({pct}%). Their performance was not tied to AI quality, making them resistant to cognitive surrender but also unable to benefit from accurate AI.

aiUser.name: AI-User
aiUser.text: You consulted the AI on {aiUsedCount} out of 7 questions. In the study, AI-Users (≥2 AI uses, n = 315 in Study 2) showed the strongest effects of cognitive surrender. They scored 80% on AI-Accurate trials but only 20.4% on AI-Faulty trials—their performance tracked AI quality, not their own ability.{surrenderNote} AI-Users in the study scored higher on Trust in AI (4.44 vs 3.45) and lower on Need for Cognition (3.36 vs 3.57) compared to Independents.
aiUser.surrenderHigh: You followed faulty AI on {followedFaultyCount}/{faultyAiAsked} faulty trials ({surrenderRate}%)—a high surrender rate, consistent with the 79.8% found in the study.
aiUser.surrenderModerate: You followed faulty AI on {followedFaultyCount}/{faultyAiAsked} faulty trials ({surrenderRate}%)—a moderate surrender rate. In the study, 79.8% followed faulty AI.
aiUser.surrenderLow: You followed faulty AI on {followedFaultyCount}/{faultyAiAsked} faulty trials ({surrenderRate}%)—you showed good resistance to faulty AI. In the study, only 20.2% overrode faulty advice.
aiUser.surrenderNone: Impressively, you overrode all faulty AI advice—only 20.2% of participants managed this in the study.

conditionBanners.brainOnly:
Brain-Only Condition
You’ve been assigned to the Brain-Only condition—no AI assistance available. This is how 121 participants experienced Study 1.
conditionBanners.aiAssisted:
AI-Assisted Condition
You’ve been assigned to the AI-Assisted condition—you can consult an AI chatbot on any question. This is how 238 participants experienced Study 1.

bridgeTexts.brainOnly: You just experienced the control condition. With no AI available, your answers reflect pure human reasoning. In the real study, Brain-Only participants (n = 121) averaged 45.8% accuracy. Other participants had access to an AI chatbot that was sometimes correct and sometimes confidently wrong. Those participants followed correct AI 92.7% of the time—but also followed faulty AI 79.8% of the time. That’s cognitive surrender.
bridgeTexts.aiAssisted: You just experienced the actual experiment. In the real study, 1,372 participants answered these same 7 CRT questions with access to an AI chatbot. The AI was sometimes correct and sometimes gave a confident but wrong answer—exactly as you experienced. Participants followed correct AI 92.7% of the time—but also followed faulty AI 79.8% of the time. That’s cognitive surrender.
